appsgate.lig.proxy.PhilipsHUE
Class PhilipsHUEAdapter

java.lang.Object
  appsgate.lig.proxy.PhilipsHUE.PhilipsHUEAdapter
All Implemented Interfaces:
PhilipsHUEServices
public class PhilipsHUEAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
implements PhilipsHUEServices

This is the adapter for Philips HUE color light technologies. It allows programmers to send REST commands to the Philips bridge and control all the connected Philips color bulbs.

Since:
May 22, 2013
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Cédric Gérard

getNewLights

public org.json.JSONArray getNewLights()
Description copied from interface: PhilipsHUEServices
Gets a list of lights that were discovered the last time a search for new lights was performed. The list of new lights is always deleted when a new search is started.

Specified by:
getNewLights in interface PhilipsHUEServices
Returns:
the list of new lights as a JSON array

searchForNewLights

public boolean searchForNewLights()
Description copied from interface: PhilipsHUEServices
Starts a search for new lights. The bridge will search for 1 minute and will add a maximum of 15 new lights. To add further lights, the command needs to be sent again after the search has completed. If a search is already active, it will be aborted and a new search will start. When the search has finished, new lights will be available using the get new lights command. In addition, the new lights will now be available by calling get all lights.

Specified by:
searchForNewLights in interface PhilipsHUEServices
Returns:
true when the search begin.

getLightState

public org.json.JSONObject getLightState(java.lang.String bridgeIP,
                                         java.lang.String id)
Description copied from interface: PhilipsHUEServices
Get the current light state. That method call return all the attributes corresponding to the remote light.

Specified by:
getLightState in interface PhilipsHUEServices
Parameters:
bridgeIP - the Philips HUE IP address
id - the light bulb id on the bridge
Returns:
all the light bulb attributes as an JSON object
